description.raw:
This will add support for running multiple worlds on a single server. Each world is managed by a `SimulationRunner`. The reason to do this are:

1. Support development and testing of distributed simulation.
2. Add multiple world support from the start, otherwise we will develop ourselves into a corner that would prevent or make it very difficult to use multiple worlds.
3. Support tasks like parameter search, pause one world then load and run another while maintaining state of the first.
4. This could eventually be used to create new models in a clean world \(model editor\), and then insert the model into a different world.

TODO list:

1. Support <physics> SDF parameters so that I can load worlds with different time steps.

    1. Implemented: [85c2e6b](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/85c2e6b5f2020d5cef3585c39b7a6b49532809c1?at=world_stats_system)
    
2. Code cleanup - there are a few commented out functions. Done

‌

Requires: [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/456/gz11-physics-dom/diff](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/456/gz11-physics-dom/diff)
